alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 12:42PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 345 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1239 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over downslope portions of the North Kona and South Kohala Districts of the Big Island. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 1.5 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kailua-Kona, Waikoloa Village, Puuanahulu, Puako, Kalaoa, Holualoa, Pohakuloa Training Area, Honalo, Kawaihae, Kahaluu- Keauhou, Kamuela, Kohala Ranch, Waikoloa Beach, Mauna Lani, Waikii and Kona International Airport. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 345 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
